lender.occupational_info:
+ Loves people for personality, heart, & sense of humor. + Finds selfish, destructive, compassion-less people unattractive. + Indulges in naps when can. Especially on Sundays. + Your clothes, car, house, job, money, looks, do not matter to me. + Notorious cuddle bug. + Extremely hard on self. + Fond of giving eyelids, foreheads & chins kisses. + When cooking puts love, soul, & feelings into it. + Tends to be a hermit/homebody + Has a thing for rusted objects. The rarer the better. + Simple person to please. + Holding hands has unfathomable meaning. + Highly fascinated by Jug bands. + Feels too much. + Loves the Arts & Craft Movement. + Pleased to give all-over body massages. Especially when someone is in pain. + Makes up songs on the fly & crudely sings them. + Propensity to think too much. + Asks crying strangers if they are OK + Wears heart on sleeve. + Eyes & voice give a *lot* away. + It's either a meaningful relationship or none. No surface dwelling.
Intense, persevering, very: emotional/sensitive, calm but seething, reserved/withdrawn/secretive, deep, passionate, loyal/devoted, willful/fanatical, mysterious, when crossed deeply resentful/brooding = very much so the Scorpio that I am.
Thank You for Visiting, Sassafrass Winter Solstice

lender.name: Eddie & Kolleena
lender.loan_because: In the past we have given monetary aid to various organizations, but never had any idea where the money went or whether it was used wisely. After learing about Kiva from Nicholas Kristof's expose for the NY Times, we decided to open an account and use our money in a more direct way to help others. We look forward to making a small, but real, difference in the world of microlending and hope to visit our lenders' countries in the years to come.
lender.occupational_info: Eddie & Kolleena live in Memphis, Tennessee, a city located on the banks of the Mississippi River and the birthplace of rock'n'roll music. Eddie is a federal public defender, representing people charged with federal crimes who cannot afford to hire an attorney on their own. Eddie loves his work because it allows him to use his blessings of education and social-economic position to help ensure that the constitutional rights of our fellow citizens are protected when the federal government seeks to take their liberty. Kolleena is a special education teacher, which means she spends her day with students who need extra attention in order to learn. Kolleena receives great fulfillment from her work because, although it takes great effort, her students demonstrate tangible signs of progress each day.

lender.occupational_info: As a high-tech PR person we develop stories around high tech products. We then share the information and "stories" with media, editors and bloggers around the world to trigger their interest. My work is mainly done on the computer, but I am fortunate to meet a lot of very bright people with great ideas in Silicon Valley and throughout the world. We also help these bright people to raise money and get the attention of Venture Capitalist so they can grow their business. I support the Soroptimist International of San Francisco, Founded in 1921, Soroptimist comprises almost 100,000 members in about 120 countries and territories worldwide who contribute time and financial support to community-based projects benefiting women. Soroptimist's major service project, the Women's Opportunity Awards program, provides cash grants for women seeking to improve their economic situation through additional education and training. Soroptimist International is a non-governmental organization with Category 1 status at the United Nations. For more information about how Soroptimist makes a difference for women, you can also go to www.soroptimist.org

lender.name: tracey & richard

We saw a report on Frontline World, and were so thoroughly impressed by the actions and dedication of every single part of the program, that we logged on and did what we could.
We are thankful that Kiva gives us this opportunity to do even a tiny part.

lender.name: Joseph
lender.loan_because: People-to-people loans are the most direct means to help individuals move from poverty to being relatively poor. I served as a Peace Corps Volunteer and have personal witness to the power of access to such micro-capital to helping people achieve individual success. As of 2007, $55 billion dollars a year is moving between family members in the US to Latin America in the form of direct aid versus the paultry $1.6 billion in government-to-government aid which is being stolen through ingraind corruption. KIVA is the best concept I have found (other than personal relationships) to match a genuine need with those wishing to help.

lender.name: Min-Ah & Stephen
lender.loan_because: There is the expression give a man a fish and he is fed for a day, but teach him to fish and he is fed for a lifetime. With micro-lenders the story goes something like the following. The man knows how to fish but he doesn't have the money to buy fishing gear. The bank won't lend him the money because they can't be bothered doing business on such a small scale. Luckily there is another kind of financial institution that can connect him with ordinary folk who happen to be blessed with more money than they need and the realization that they are lucky to be in that situation. So the fellow gets his gear. Groups like Kiva are the other kind of financial organization. You and I are the lucky and you know it. If you aren't already doing your part what are you waiting for?

His mother, brother and himself escaped the country with what they could fit in his mother's purse and left there family and beautiful home behind them. His father was a Captain for Ariana Airways and parked his plane in Europe and met up with them in the United States. My husband is a self made man and we have been blessed with successful careers and healthy children, Ariana, Evan, and Tye, and we feel that our good fortune should be shared with others.
